alert.note: Alert for Bryan; Carter; Johnston; Love; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 08 at 10:40AM CDT until June 08 at 11:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Johnston County in southeastern Oklahoma... Western Bryan County in southeastern Oklahoma... Love County in southern Oklahoma... Southeastern Carter County in southern Oklahoma... Marshall County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 1145 AM CDT. * At 1040 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ravia to 6 miles northwest of Lebanon to near Rubottom, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Durant, Madill, Tishomingo, Marietta, Kingston, Dickson, Colbert, Mannsville, Ravia, Achille, Thackerville, Silo, Kemp, Mead, Armstrong, Leon, Hendrix, Cartwright, Utica and Burneyville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
